references: We first compare our baseline and joint training without test-time adaption against our proposed method MT3. Additionally, we show the results of MT3 with fixed parameters at test-time (MT), thus without a gradient step at test-time. The results on the 15 corruption types of the CIFAR-10-Corrupted images are shown in Table 2 with their mean and standard deviation estimated over 3 runs. Furthermore, the average accuracy over all corruption types for each run is given by its mean and standard deviation. In case of TTT, the model parameters are adapted before the prediction of each single test image. The final accuracy is then calculated over the predictions of the 10,000 adapted models.
